title: The Moz Blog [SEO] - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Rand Fishkin January 18, 2005 Folksonomies Moz News An impressive new idea from the world of librarians, cataloguers and other reference technicians called Folksonomies has taken root in the world of web search. This new technology exploits users' time to classify and meta-label the web through browsing. The promise of this new categorization syte... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 17, 2005 Site Flavored Theme Detection from Google Search Engines In September of 2003, Google acquired Kaltix Corp. While this was well reported in the blogosphere and the SEO industry, it's fascincating to see the direct correlation between this acquisi... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 16, 2005 W3C Valid Code Design Code validation is an issue that has been tossed back and forth in the SEO world for years. The W3C's standards appear to have the general support of the validation and standards organizations across the Internet, thus leading SEOs to ask the leading question,Does having validated ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 15, 2005 Serious Sandbox Theories Blogging An impressive thread, started by yours truly at SEOChat - Sandbox just a Google-Only Algorithm Piece? has initiated some of the best high-level discussion on Google's unique filter in recent times. A great variety of SEO theorists... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 11, 2005 Google's Results Different for Everyone Search Engines The creation and promulgation of the SEO tools here has led to many people noting that the results returned by the tools are often different from the results they see. This problem can be pinpointed to the datacenter at Google that is being used to get the results.... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 1, 2004 A Google Rep's Comments on PageRank in the Toolbar Search Engines The following is a quote of a Google representative writing to JohnGalt of search engine watch forums: "The PageRank that is displayed in the Google Toolbar is for entertainment purposes only. Due to repeated attempts by hackers to... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 9, 2004 Mi Islita - Truly Advanced SEO Public Relations Dr. Garcia, well known by his nickname - Orion - at SearchEngineWatch forums has an exceptional resource that all SEOs looking to delve seriously into the industry should read thoroughly. The site, Mi Islita, a Puerto Rican based SEO company, ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 5, 2004 Age of Websites Search Engines An excellent thread at SEOChat is helping to uncover an uncomfortable phenomenon at Google - sites that rank well are very, very old. While this has been speculated about for many months, these are the first publications of any scale to be released.Read the thread - ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 31, 2004 EGOL from SEOChat Blows Minds SEO Events In two excellent posts in reply to an old theory about a conspiracy surrounding Google's toolbar, EGOL points out the value of SEO money being spent on internally developed content and then goes on to say:Someday, google will rank a site mainly, if not entirely, by its c... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 15, 2004 Older Sites Succeeding? Search Engines In the initial testing of the survey, one fact that consistently appears in the results that rank in the top 10 are sites that have been around a long time. Obviously, these sites have had greater time to build links & content, but there appears to be little correlation between these it... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 14, 2004 Analyze the Google Link Command Search Engines RustyBrick - a frequent poster on SEOChat and many of the other major search engine forums released a tool over the summer that conducts an advanced analysis of the links listed in Google's link command. ... Read this post
